column2: These laws define how fair or harsh miscreants in your realm are punished, and expands what a "miscreant" may happen to be.
Every man and woman in your country is free to live and express themselves as they please without much interference from you.
Order in your realm is more aggressively pursued. Lawmen around your nation are dispatched to keep order and suppress potential rebellion.
Your judges and lawmen are given more authority to arrest and otherwise interrupt anyone they suspect of treasounous activity. Their methods can often be heavy-handed.

Every movement, conversation, and message in your state is being tracked by your vast network of spys and lawmen. Life in your country is hard, as any man can be accused of being a rebel or heretic and taken away, but at least you need not fear insurrection.
More order in the realm is a good thing.
Perhaps that would be a bit much.
The people deserve freedom and autonomy
These laws determine the composition of the realm's Armed Forces.
Your army is composed by soldiers called upon to your service directly from your nation, or those in your vassals ranks that are sent according to their vassalage.
Your army is partially composed by troops conscripted from the populace.
All eligible males are conscripted into the army when they come of age, serving a number of years before retirement.
